meanings.definition: To cast a fishing line backward
meanings.sent1: He carefully backcast his line to catch the big fish.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman backcast his line to reach the deeper waters.
meanings.sent3: The backcast of his line startled the nearby ducks.
meanings.sent4: Her backcast was so precise, it seemed like magic.
meanings.sent5: With a swift backcast, he landed the lure right where he wanted.

meanings.definition: A backward cast in fly fishing
meanings.sent1: The backcast in fly fishing requires skill and practice.
meanings.sent2: He performed a perfect backcast to lure the trout.
meanings.sent3: The backcast in fly fishing looked like a graceful dance.
meanings.sent4: Her backcast in fly fishing was like poetry in motion.
meanings.sent5: The backcast in fly fishing was a thing of beauty to watch.

meanings.definition: To think about or consider something that happened in the past
meanings.sent1: She would often backcast on her childhood memories.
meanings.sent2: He liked to backcast on the good times he had with friends.
meanings.sent3: Backcasting on embarrassing moments always made him cringe.
meanings.sent4: Backcasting on past mistakes can help us learn and grow.
meanings.sent5: Backcasting on happy memories brings a smile to her face.
